title: Air France posts revenue growth as loss widens; to accelerate cost cuts
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Jul 24, 2015, 11:05 BST - UK Markets close in 5 hrs 25 mins Air France posts revenue growth as loss widens; to accelerate cost cuts By Victoria Young | Sharecast – 17 minutes ago 6.823 +0.230 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Shares (Frankfurt: DI6.F - news ) in Air France-KLM (Other OTC: AFLYY - news ) rose on Friday as the company's second-quarter operating profit and revenue beat market expectations. The airline posted a sharply lower operating profit of €185m, but this still above analysts' forecasts for around €150m. Air France (Paris: FR 31122 - news ) reported a loss of €79m, wider than the €11m it posted in the same period last year, but revenues grew 3% to €6.64bn from €6.45bn in 201. 
As the company struggles to bring in a profit amid increasing competition and a weaker euro, it said it would accelerate its cost-cutting plans to make €1.8bn in savings over the next two years. 
Chief executive Alexandre de Juniac said Air France experienced exceptional volatility in exchange rates and the fuel price, and on-going pressure on unit revenues. 
"The lack of results improvement leads us to implement immediate additional adaptation measures including, in particular, the closure of heavily loss-making routes, the downward revision in capacity for the forthcoming winter season, together with acceleration and an increase in the magnitude of our cost-saving initiatives." Still, management retained its full-year outlook. 
Societe Generale (Paris: FR0000130809 - news ) said the numbers were "a beat versus low expectations", with the sales and operating results ahead. 
Shares in the airline, which have lost more than 20% of the past year, were up by 3.2% to €6.80 at 09:42.
